panels.description: cls = ${cls}. Used as an unique cluster identifier and resource namespace.
panels.title: Cluster

panels.description: ins = ${ins}, used as unique instance identifier. Formed as {{ cls }}-{{ seq }}.
panels.title: Instance

panels.description: Services in cluster ${cls}. On(green) means current instance are member of that service. Off(orange) means the opposite.
ip = ${ip}. Unique identifier for corresponding node
panels.title: Node IP

panels.description: Important configuration entries of this instance
panels.title: Configuration

panels.description:
Aliveness of major components on instance ${ins}
uptime of node and database. aliveness of postgres, pgbouncer, node and haproxy
panels.title: Aliveness

panels.description: Replication Facts about this instance: In recovery, In sync commit mode, has replication descendant. has publication, has subscription

targets.expr: count by (ins)(pg_pubrel_count{ins="$ins"}) > bool 0 or on() vector(0)

panels.title: Replication

targets.expr: max by (cls,ins)(pg_repl_replay_lag{ins="$ins"} or pg:ins:lag_seconds{ins="$ins"} or pg_lag{ins="$ins"})

panels.description:
Overall pressure for this PostgreSQL Node and Instance. 
max(node:ins:cpu_usage, pg:ins:load, pgbouncer:ins:load)
Alerting event graph. Each stripe represent an alerting Event. Gray transparent stipe are pending alerts.

list.description: IP address of this postgres instance
list.label: IP
list.name: ip

list.description: Sequence number of this instance, which is an unique integer among a postgres cluster
list.label: Sequence
list.name: seq

list.description: Cluster identifier for this postgres instance, cls should be unique among entire environment. such as pg-meta, pg-test
list.label: Cluster
list.name: cls

list.description: Node name of current postgres instance
list.label: Node
list.name: node
